title: Contributory Parent visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Contributory Parent visa (subclass 143), a permanent visa that allows eligible parents of settled Australian citizens, permanent residents, or eligible New Zealand citizens to migrate to Australia. It outlines visa benefits, eligibility requirements, costs, application procedures, processing times, and conditions.

structured_data.description: This permanent visa lets a parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident, or eligible New Zealand citizen move to Australia.

important_updates.details: Applicants for Parent visa subclasses 143, 173, 804, 864 and 884 will be able to import their paper application into ImmiAccount after lodgement. Parent visa (subclass 103) applications lodged after November 2018 can also be imported.

visa_conditions: Sponsor family members to come to Australia
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Attend free Adult Migrant English Program classes (if eligible)

main_requirements: Have an eligible child who is a settled Australian citizen, permanent resident, or eligible New Zealand citizen
Must not have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) (subclass 870) visa when applying
retiree_exemptions: Do not need to meet the balance of family test
Do not need an assurance of support

travel_conditions.initial_travel_facility: 5 years from date of visa grant
after_5_years: Apply for a Resident Return visa (RRV) to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
Consider applying for Australian citizenship, after which no visa is required to enter Australia

via_subclass_173.description: Temporary Contributory Parent visa holders (subclass 173) can apply for subclass 143 as part of a 2-step process.
via_subclass_173.benefits: Allows the cost to be spread over several years.
via_subclass_173.notes: Balance of family test already met if applying from subclass 173.

citizenship_residency_start.if_in_australia: On the date the visa is granted
citizenship_residency_start.if_outside_australia: On the date the holder enters Australia on this visa

general_rules: Can include members of the family unit in the application
Must include details of all family members whether migrating or not
Family members applying must meet health and character requirements
Non-migrating family members may also need to meet health and character requirements
family_members.newborn_child: Special instructions apply if a child is born after application lodgement.

payment_structure: Second instalment payable when requested by the Department
links: Fees and charges for other services

conditions: If applying in Australia, all included family members must also be in Australia and not in immigration clearance
If applying outside Australia, family members must also be outside Australia
Retiree applicants must be in Australia (not in immigration clearance) when applying
Applicants may be either in or outside Australia at the time of decision

notes: Demand for Parent visas is greater than the number of available places each year
Applications are capped and queued and processed in order of receipt
delays_possible_if: Information takes a long time to verify
processing_times.payment_requirement: Application cannot be processed if the correct visa application charge is not paid
assessment_stages: Initial assessment for eligibility and queuing or refusal
Final assessment once a place becomes available
processing_times.important_note: Applicants should not arrange permanent stay in Australia until visa grant

other_parent_visa_options.name: Contributory Parent (Temporary) visa
other_parent_visa_options.notes: Can be followed by a permanent Contributory Parent visa (subclass 143)

help_with_visa.guidance: Read information on who can help with your visa application before paying someone for assistance
